Name: /create-session
Description: Create multi-agent session with real-time file tracking and git verification

Name: base-frontmatter-schema.json
Description: Universal Documentation Standards (UDS) base schema - required fields for ALL markdown documents in CodeRef ecosystem

Name: foundation-doc-frontmatter-schema.json
Description: Validates YAML front matter for foundation docs (README, ARCHITECTURE, API, SCHEMA, COMPONENTS) generated by coderef-docs. Extends base-frontmatter-schema.json with workorder tracking and doc_type fields.

Name: infrastructure-doc-frontmatter-schema.json
Description: Validates YAML front matter for infrastructure documentation (deployment guides, CI/CD, monitoring, configuration). Infrastructure docs describe system setup, deployment, and operations.

Name: migration-doc-frontmatter-schema.json
Description: Validates YAML front matter for migration documentation (migration guides, deprecation notices, upgrade paths). Migration docs describe how to transition from old to new systems.

Name: resource-sheet-metadata-schema.json
Description: Validates YAML front matter in resource/reference sheets for UDS and RSMS compliance

Name: script-frontmatter-schema.json
Description: Validates YAML frontmatter in script and test files for triangular bidirectional references

Name: session-doc-frontmatter-schema.json
Description: Validates YAML front matter for session documentation (communication.json, instructions.json, session summaries). Session docs coordinate multi-agent work.

Name: standards-doc-frontmatter-schema.json
Description: Validates YAML front matter for standards documentation (global-documentation-standards.md, resource-sheet-standards.md, etc.). Standards docs define policies, conventions, and enforcement rules.

Name: system-doc-frontmatter-schema.json
Description: Validates YAML front matter for system documentation (CLAUDE.md, SESSION-INDEX.md, etc.). System docs describe codebase architecture, session management, and project history.

Name: user-facing-doc-frontmatter-schema.json
Description: Validates YAML front matter for user-facing documentation (guides, tutorials, FAQs in coderef/user/). User docs are allowed to contain emojis per EMOJI-TIMESTAMP-POLICY.md.

Name: workorder-doc-frontmatter-schema.json
Description: Validates YAML front matter for workorder docs generated by coderef-workflow

Name: error-responses-schema.json
Description: JSON Schema definitions for error response factory - consistent error formatting across all MCP tools

Name: mcp-client-schema.json
Description: Type definitions and validation contracts for MCP inter-server communication client

Name: server-schema.json
Description: Type definitions and validation contracts for coderef-workflow MCP server

Name: tool-handlers-schema.json
Description: Type definitions and validation contracts for coderef-workflow MCP tool handlers

Name: type-defs-schema.json
Description: JSON Schema definitions for all 71 TypedDicts in type_defs.py - the canonical type system for coderef-workflow MCP server

Name: constants-schema.json
Description: JSON Schema definitions for centralized constants - paths, files, enums, and validation rules

Name: plan-validator-schema.json
Description: Type definitions and validation contracts for PlanValidator class

Name: planning-analyzer-schema.json
Description: Type definitions and validation contracts for PlanningAnalyzer class

Name: planning-generator-schema.json
Description: Type definitions and validation contracts for PlanningGenerator class

Name: stub-schema.json
Description: Canonical schema for stub.json files across orchestrator and dashboard

Name: validation-schema.json
Description: JSON Schema definitions for validation functions - security boundary for all tool inputs

Name: agent-communication-schema.json
Description: Agent-specific task tracking within a session subdirectory. Used in hierarchical multi-agent sessions where each agent has their own workspace.

Name: agent-instructions-schema.json
Description: Detailed execution steps for agent within session subdirectory. Provides step-by-step guidance, task specifications, and context templates for autonomous agent execution.

Name: communication-schema.json
Description: Agent roster and status tracking for multi-agent sessions in the CodeRef ecosystem. Supports 1-N agents (flexible agent count, not fixed roster). Optional phase tracking for multi-phase sessions.

Name: analysis-json-schema.json
Description: Schema for project analysis files generated by coderef-workflow analyze_project_for_planning. Contains structured analysis data for planning decisions.

Name: execution-log-json-schema.json
Description: Schema for task execution logs generated by coderef-workflow. Tracks task progress for plan.json tasks with workorder traceability.

Name: base_generator.py
Description: Base generator with shared logic for all documentation generators.

Name: changelog_generator.py
Description: Changelog generator for managing CHANGELOG.json entries.

Name: features_inventory_generator.py
Description: Features inventory generator for scanning and cataloging project features.

Name: handoff_generator.py
Description: Handoff context generator for automated agent handoffs.

Name: planning_generator.py
Description: Planning generator for creating implementation plans.

Name: quickref_generator.py
Description: Generator for universal quickref guides for any application type.

Name: base_generator.py
Description: Base generator with shared logic for all documentation generators.

Name: changelog_generator.py
Description: Changelog generator for managing CHANGELOG.json entries.

Name: features_inventory_generator.py
Description: Features inventory generator for scanning and cataloging project features.

Name: handoff_generator.py
Description: Handoff context generator for automated agent handoffs.

Name: planning_generator.py
Description: Planning generator for creating implementation plans.

Name: quickref_generator.py
Description: Generator for universal quickref guides for any application type.

Name: user_guide_generator.py
Description: User documentation generator for my-guide, user-guide, and features docs.

Name: coderef_complexity
Description: Get complexity metrics for a code element

Name: coderef_context
Description: Generate comprehensive codebase context with visual architecture diagram. Returns project metadata, stats, and ready-to-render Mermaid diagram in single call.

Name: coderef_coverage
Description: Analyze test coverage in the codebase

Name: coderef_diagram
Description: Generate visual dependency diagrams (Mermaid or Graphviz)

Name: coderef_drift
Description: Detect drift between CodeRef index and current code

Name: coderef_export
Description: Export coderef data in various formats (JSON, JSON-LD, Mermaid, DOT)

Name: coderef_impact
Description: Analyze impact of modifying or deleting a code element

Name: coderef_incremental_scan
Description: Perform incremental scan (only re-scan files with detected drift, merge with existing index)

Name: coderef_patterns
Description: Discover code patterns and test coverage gaps

Name: coderef_query
Description: Query code relationships (what-calls, what-imports, shortest-path, etc)

Name: coderef_scan
Description: Scan project and discover all code elements (functions, classes, components, hooks)

Name: coderef_tag
Description: Add CodeRef2 tags to source files for better tracking and validation

Name: validate_coderef_outputs
Description: Validate .coderef/ files against schemas using Papertrail MCP validation

Name: add_changelog_entry
Description: Add a new entry to the project changelog. Requires all change details including version, type, title, description, files, reason, and impact.

Name: audit_codebase
Description: Audit codebase for standards violations using established standards documents. Scans all source files, compares against standards, and generates comprehensive compliance report with violations, severity levels, and fix suggestions.

Name: check_consistency
Description: Check code changes against established standards for consistency violations. Lightweight quality gate for pre-commit checks and CI/CD pipelines. Only scans modified files. Auto-detects changes via git or accepts explicit file list.

Name: check_document_health
Description: Calculate health score (0-100) for document based on 4 factors: Traceability (40%% - has workorder_id, feature_id, MCP attribution), Completeness (30%% - required sections present), Freshness (20%% - document age), Validation (10%% - passes schema). Phase 3: Papertrail integration.

Name: coderef_foundation_docs
Description: [DEPRECATED] Use generate_foundation_docs instead. CONSOLIDATE-002 (WO-GENERATION-ENHANCEMENT-001): This tool is deprecated and will be removed in v5.0.0. It has been superseded by generate_foundation_docs which offers better MCP integration, drift detection, and sequential generation. Migration: Replace coderef_foundation_docs(path) with generate_foundation_docs(path).

Name: establish_standards
Description: Scan codebase to discover UI/UX/behavior patterns and generate standards documentation. Creates 4 markdown files in coderef/standards/. Run ONCE per project to establish baseline standards for consistency validation (Tools #9 and #10).

Name: generate_features
Description: USER-005 (WO-GENERATION-ENHANCEMENT-001): Generate FEATURES.md - features inventory with workorder tracking. Scans coderef/workorder/ and coderef/archived/ directories, extracts workorder IDs and status from plan.json files, generates executive summary with metrics and feature lifecycle documentation.

Name: generate_foundation_docs
Description: Generate foundation documentation (README, ARCHITECTURE, API, COMPONENTS, SCHEMA) for a project. Returns templates and generation plan - Claude will generate and save the actual documents.

Name: generate_individual_doc
Description: [INTERNAL] Generate a single individual documentation file. Called by generate_foundation_docs for sequential generation. Not recommended for direct use - use generate_foundation_docs instead. CONSOLIDATE-001 (WO-GENERATION-ENHANCEMENT-001): Marked as internal tool.

Name: generate_my_guide
Description: USER-003 (WO-GENERATION-ENHANCEMENT-001): Generate my-guide.md - concise 60-80 line reference with MCP tools and slash commands. Auto-discovers tools from .coderef/index.json and commands from .claude/commands/. Categorizes by function (Documentation, Changelog, Standards, etc.).

Name: generate_quickref_interactive
Description: Interactive workflow to generate a universal quickref guide for ANY application (CLI, Web, API, Desktop, Library). Returns interview questions for AI to ask user. AI guides conversation, user answers in plain English, then AI generates scannable quickref.md (150-250 lines) following proven pattern.

Name: generate_resource_sheet
Description: Generate composable module-based technical documentation for code elements. Replaces rigid templates with ~30-40 small modules that compose intelligently. Auto-detects code characteristics, selects appropriate modules, and generates markdown + JSON schema + JSDoc outputs. WO-RESOURCE-SHEET-MCP-TOOL-001

Name: generate_user_guide
Description: USER-004 (WO-GENERATION-ENHANCEMENT-001): Generate USER-GUIDE.md - comprehensive 10-section onboarding guide with Prerequisites, Installation, Architecture, Tools Reference, Commands, Workflows, Best Practices, Troubleshooting, and Quick Reference. Leverages .coderef/ data for 75%+ auto-fill.

Name: get_template
Description: Retrieves the content of a specific documentation template

Name: list_templates
Description: Lists all available documentation templates (README, ARCHITECTURE, API, COMPONENTS, SCHEMA)

Name: record_changes
Description: Smart agentic changelog recording with git auto-detection. Auto-detects changed files (git diff --staged), suggests change_type from commit messages, calculates severity from scope, and shows preview for agent confirmation before creating entry.

Name: validate_document
Description: Validate document against UDS (Universal Documentation Standards) schema. Checks for required sections, metadata format (workorder_id, timestamps), and returns validation errors/warnings with severity levels. Phase 3: Papertrail integration.

Name: clear_persona
Description: Deactivate the current persona and return to default state.

Name: create_custom_persona
Description: Create a custom persona through guided workflow with automatic system prompt generation and validation. Users provide expertise, communication style, and use cases - the system generates a complete persona definition.

Name: execute_plan_interactive
Description: Execute plan with guided step-by-step or batch mode. Part of docs-expert v2.0 Phase 1.

Name: generate_todo_list
Description: Convert plan task breakdown to TodoWrite format for Lloyd. Part of docs-expert v2.0 Phase 1.

Name: get_active_persona
Description: Get information about the currently active persona.

Name: list_personas
Description: List all available personas with their descriptions.

Name: track_plan_execution
Description: Sync plan progress with todo status in real-time. Part of docs-expert v2.0 Phase 1.

Name: use_persona
Description: Activate an expert persona to gain specialized knowledge and behavior. Returns the persona's system prompt and expertise.

Name: BaseUDSValidator
Description: Base class for all UDS validators

Name: FoundationDocValidator
Description: Validates foundation documentation generated by coderef-docs

Name: ResourceSheetValidator
Description: Validator for resource sheet documentation files.

Name: AnalysisValidator
Description: Validator for project analysis JSON files

Name: ExecutionLogValidator
Description: Validator for execution log JSON files

Name: PlanValidator
Description: Validates implementation plans against schema and quality checklist.

Name: WorkorderDocValidator
Description: Validates workorder documentation generated by coderef-workflow

Name: Complete Feature Implementation
Description: End-to-end workflow from planning to completion (3 phases: Plan Execute Complete)

Name: Git Release Workflow
Description: Tag version update changelog create release (3 phases: Prepare Tag Publish)

Name: Documentation Update
Description: Update foundation docs when code changes (3 phases: Scan Generate Validate)

Name: Multi-Agent Session
Description: Create and manage multi-agent session (4 steps: Structure Agents Execute Track)
